p: In the II World War, also driven by the inherent difficulties for the extraction of quinine from the bark of Cinchona, the United States started working in 1942 on an alternative synthetic drug, Atabrine (Curico et al. 2008). A couple of years later, american researchers in collaboration with pharmaceutical industries attempted to produce a synthetic quinine, but technical drawbacks and the large-scale production costs made this attempt impossible (Lee 2002).
